data.title: repaint / refresh of file when saving
data.body:
### Description

During the save of a file, Atom seems to lose the file's context and repaints the file. Meaning that it will no longer know what the file's type is and it reloads the file. The biggest issue with this is that it will unfold all lines of code. which is a problem if you use function folding as an organizational method.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file. The most obvious moments of this issue are with JavaScript files that are large, more than 3000 lines of code. However, this happens no matter what the type of the file is and also no matter its size.
2. Fold a few functions or blocks of code, and then make a change somewhere in the file.
3. Save the file and notice the immediate repaint where all blocks of folded code are unfolded and there is a slight moment where all syntax coloring is removed from the open file.

**Expected behavior:** In previous versions of Atom, there wasn't a repaint and all folded blocks of code remained folded.

**Actual behavior:** Please see description.
### Versions

Atom: 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome: 49.0.2623.75
Node: 5.10.0

APM: 1.12.5
NPM: 3.10.5
Node: 4.4.5
Python: 2.7.10
Git: 2.8.1

macOS: 10.12

data.title: Atom plugins ignore sound device select (Gnome)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Y] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [Y] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [Y] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [N] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [IDK] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [Y] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

On Gnome Desktop, system notifications always using default sound device. You can alter that behaviour, but from the box, they ignore headset presence. Which is for most cases acceptable.

But somehow, Atom (Or maybe electron itself?) using such channel too. Which making plugins like audio player / youtube window / chrome plus ignore headset.

**I am asking maintainer to prove**, that this is not issue of Atom itself, before i will flag this case to Electron/Gnome/PulseAudio community. Because my assumption, it either can be bad configuration in atom, issue in Electron or Gnome.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install any Gnome distributive
2. Plug in headset and select in in sound settings
3. Install any of those:
   https://atom.io/packages/atom-music
   https://atom.io/packages/youtube-pane

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Music playing from headset.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Music playing from laptop speakers.
### Versions

apm  1.13.0
npm  2.15.9
node 4.6.0
python 2.7.12
git 2.7.4

Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

Fedora 24 x64
Gnome 3.20.2

data.title: Unable to connect to Atom in any fashion through the app in Windows 10. "Loading themes", etc.
data.body:
### Description

I installed Atom in the most basic way possible. Went to the website, clicked "Download Windows Installer". It did it's thing. Now I can open Atom, but I can't seem to download any packages, themes, anything. 

https://postimg.org/image/ooxogddat/
https://postimg.org/image/6nejikj9x/

I've googled this for a while, I've tried setting my environmental variables to every path in existence. Still nothing. I've run Atom in safe mode (i.e. I can run it from the command line). Not sure what else to try. Something extremely basic is missing in the install process. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download Atom on Windows 10
2. You can't download anything from github or atom in general

**Expected behavior:** 

I would be able to download a snazzy theme (or APIs to use this as my Python IDE or whatever).

**Actual behavior:** 

I was not able to download any snazzy themes. 
### Versions

Running 'apm --version' gets me:

```
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 3.5.2
git 2.10.1.windows.1
visual studio
```

data.title: Tooltip for tab lingers after closing pane
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? ### Description Tooltip displaying full path of file when hovering over tab remains if you right click and close pane. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open a file 2. Open a second file in a split pane (e.g: right click file in tree, click "Split right") 3. Hover over one of the tabs until the blue tooltip pops up showing the file's full path 4. Without moving off the tab, right click and select "Close pane" **Expected behavior:** The tooltip disappears when the tab is closed with the pane **Actual behavior:** The tooltip remains, even if you interact with, hover over, and close other tabs. ### Versions ``` $ atom -v Atom : 1.11.2 Electron: 0.37.8 Chrome : 49.0.2623.75 Node : 5.10.0 $ apm -v apm 1.12.5 npm 3.10.5 node 4.4.5 python 2.7.10 git 2.8.4 ```

data.title: Erratic behaviour of atom.workspace.open
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When executing `atom.workspace.open("myNewFile")` (e.g. in the console), Atom behaves differently on different platforms and whether in Developer Mode or not.
### Steps to Reproduce

The following has been tested Safe Mode (`atom --safe` and `atom --safe --dev`):
#### macOS 10.12 / Atom 1.11.2

In both, regular mode and Developer Mode, `atom.workspace.open("myNewFile")` opens new tab "untitled". However, when I'm outside of Safe Mode and in Developer Mode, it opens a new tab titled "myNewFile" (as expected!)
#### Windows 10.0.14393 / Atom 1.11.2

In both, regular mode and Developer Mode, `atom.workspace.open("myNewFile")` opens new tab titled "myNewFile".
#### Fedora 24 (GNOME 3.20.2) / Atom 1.11.2-0.1

Same as Windows

**Expected behavior:** All version to behave consistently like on Windows and Linux

**Actual behavior:** macOS behaves differently
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
#### macOS 10.12

``` bash
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4
```
#### Windows 10.0.14393

``` cmd
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.3.windows.1
visual studio
```
#### Fedora 24

``` bash
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.7.4
```

data.title: Style tag commenting inside HTML file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Yes] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [Yes] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [No ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [No] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [Yes ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [Yes] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Issue: While commenting style tag in HTML file it is getting commenting format(/\* */) of CSS style sheet. 
Correct Flow: It should have commenting style of HTML(<!-- -->) if comment has been applied to style tags inside html file.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Have inline CSS content into html file
2.  Comment style tag inside html file using CTRL + /

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
It should have commenting style of HTML(<!-- -->) if comment has been applied to style tags inside html file.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
While commenting style tag in HTML file it is getting commenting format(/\* */) of CSS style sheet.
### Versions

1.11.2

data.title: 1.12 releases
Error in launching (Scientific Linux 6)
data.body:
I just installed for the first time atom on my system. 

when I try to launch it for the first time I get the error:

`usr/share/atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: libnotify.so.4: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
`

Since I'm quite new to SL6, I could use some help figuring out what is the issue and how to solve it!

data.title: Polish letters issue
data.body:
That issue is still present on newest atom version (1.11.2).... I'm able to type most of the letters:
ą - alt+a
 ź - alt+x
 ł - alt+l 
ń - alt+n 
ę - alt+e
 ś - alt+s 
ć - alt+c
But these letters aren't possible to type:
ó - alt+o
ż - alt+z

Add support to these letters, it is really annoying issue 😕

data.title: Change editor:duplicate-lines to only duplicate once per line
data.body:
Adds a fix to only duplicate a line once, no matter how many selections exist on the same line. The selections are set correctly on the duplicated line.
![anim](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/416212/19617150/e1b120bc-97dd-11e6-8a75-3ba4d4c7fc2e.gif)

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12927

data.title: Project history api, reopen project menu and command
data.body:
## Implements new
- `atom.history` API containing `.getProjects()`, `.clearProjects()` and `.onDidChangeProjects(callback)` public API surface
- 'Reopen Project' menu that lists the **15** most recently opened projects (configurable via `core.reopenProjectMenuCount`)
- `application:reopen-project` command that provides a search across all projects opened
- `application:clear-project-history` command to clear project history
## Notes
- For now you can type `atom.history.importProjectHistory()` in the debug window to build your initial list from Atom's internal window-state history. Am considering making this happen automatically when you first run Atom with no existing project history state file.
- Multiple folder projects appear in the menu as the last name in the paths separated by a comma e.g. 'atom, settings-view' for width. They appear in full in the pop-up palette.
- Reopening a project always appears in a new window as window-state is preserved between projects and it is quite jarring otherwise.
- 'Clear Project History' appears at the top of the menu instead of ideally at the bottom due to limitations of the MenuManager and how it handles separators. Will be addressed in the future once that is resolved.
- Setting `core.reopenProjectMenuCount` does not disable the menu right now because of the same limitations as above (removing at run-time refuses to remove the separator)
## Screenshots
### Reopen Project menu

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/19613861/4e6ea51a-97a4-11e6-8d45-606e712e2e99.png)
### Reopen Project command list picker

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/19613853/3cc98fbe-97a4-11e6-9c89-3a285318d322.png)

data.title: Uncaught Error: Could not read current keyboard layout
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. click ctrl-alt-y (any keyboard conbine with no keybingds).

**Atom Version**: 1.12.0-beta3
**Electron Version**: 1.3.6
**System**: Mac OS X 10.12.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Could not read current keyboard layout

```
At /Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/keyboard-layout/lib/keyboard-layout.js:21

Error: Could not read current keyboard layout
    at Error (native)
    at Object.getCurrentKeymap (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/keyboard-layout/lib/keyboard-layout.js:21:29)
    at nonAltModifiedKeyForKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/helpers.js:255:52)
    at exports.keystrokeForKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/helpers.js:186:31)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.keystrokeForKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:443:14)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:331:24)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentKeyEvent (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:106:36)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:3:59)
```
### Commands

```
     -4:40.6.0 project-find:show (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -4:40.3.0 core:paste (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -4:39.5.0 core:confirm (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -4:37.4.0 core:close (ol.results-view.list-tree.focusable-panel.has-collapsable-children)

     -4:06.1.0 core:paste (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -3:58.8.0 command-palette:toggle (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -3:58.3.0 editor:consolidate-selections (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -3:58.3.0 core:cancel (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -3:33.5.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -3:21.7.0 find-and-replace:select-all (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -3:21.6.0 window:toggle-full-screen (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
  3x -3:11.8.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -1:25.9.0 core:copy (atom-notification.fatal.icon.icon-bug.native-key-bindings.has-detail.has-close.has-stack)
     -0:01.3.0 core:close (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "autosave",
      "bookmarks",
      "open-on-github",
      "spell-check",
      "package-generator",
      "styleguide",
      "wrap-guide",
      "feedback",
      "link",
      "git-projects",
      "autoflow",
      "metrics",
      "welcome",
      "about",
      "release-notes",
      "symbols-view",
      "background-tips"
    ],
    "followSymlinks": false,
    "packagesWithKeymapsDisabled": [
      "keybinding-resolver",
      "git-control"
    ],
    "projectHome": "/Users/zzjin/projects",
    "telemetryConsent": "limited",
    "themes": [
      "nucleus-dark-ui",
      "gruvbox"
    ],
    "useCustomTitleBar": true
  },
  "editor": {
    "backUpBeforeSaving": true,
    "fontFamily": "monoid",
    "invisibles": {},
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "tabLength": 4
  }
}
```

data.title: macOS: Let atom.sh find itself when run from an .app
data.body:
**Problem** This patch is needed because `node-gyp` doesn't work with a space in `Atom Beta.app` -> renamed to `Atom-Beta.app`. This error occurs:

```
Cannot locate Atom.app, it is usually located in /Applications. Set the ATOM_PATH environment variable to the directory containing Atom.app.
```

**Use case** Developers/others want to multiple versions of Atom side-by-side.

**Solution** When launched from a Mac .app, a valid, symlinked `atom.sh` -> `atom`/`atom-beta` will always be contained in it's .app. This also works when a different `atom-something` symlink points to another atom.sh in an .app.

data.title: How can I set the path where the packages are installed for a specific instance of Atom ?
data.body:
Hi

I have a setup with an atomPortable.exe found here: https://github.com/garethflowers/atom-portable
Have I to use your repository to have a atom portable ? I don't know how to do with yours if it's possible

Also, I have an atom installed with right admin in the user folder with a .atom and some plugins. 

I want to put the plugins in my special folder  with my portable Atom which is on the other location but when I write `apm install my_plugin`, it install it in my .atom folder under the user `C:\Users\Kevin\.atom\Data\packages` something like that and not where I have my portableAtom which is `C:\PortableAtom\Data\packages`. 

How can I tell it, OK I want that you install here every time with my commander line ? Or maybe there is an other way ? I don't know :/

Thank you

data.title: Req. for enhancement: Project manager which is NOT a directory listing.
data.body:
I am using Notepad++ currently, and I prefer the Workspace/Project management it uses (View|Workspace|Workspace Panel1). In it you add files individually to a project. More than occasionally, I have files in a project which are no longer in use, are alternate versions which I did not bother to make a branch for, might be notes I took or are example code. Directory listing-based project managers generally have no easy way to exclude these files. I'd rather use the model that I ADD the files which ARE in a project, instead of SUBTRACTING files which are not. (It also has a new feature, "Folder as Workspace", thereby giving users the choice). It is easy enough, after all, to multi-select files which are. Ideally, one might be able to right-click on a file's tab, and choose "Add to project". I imagine it might be a plug-in for those who prefer not to work that way (well, nearly all of Atom is plugins), but if there is a plug-in that comes close to this for me to post an issue on, I do not know what it is.

Of the usual features I first look for in evaluating a new text editor, this is the principle one which Atom does not seem to have. (Spell-checking might ignore keywords; but this is not a stopper for me. This is impressive for such a new editor, BTW.)

Note: This is not a question, but an enhancement request.  Also note that in Notepad++, this is part of the core, so this is not necessarily about a "package"; or to state it more accurately, this is not necessarily about a non-core package - although I don't propose by any means for it to be the only official form of project management either.

One great feature this project manager might have, is to create a project from a git or hg repository.  After all, one is not forced to add directories in Git or Hg; and when one does, and then add new files, they are not automatically part of the repository.  Why shouldn't a text editor have a project manager work that way?  I am keen to get Atom started on this early on.  Netbeans is a mature text editor, and does not have this; but it is not uncommon either.

data.title: Adding < as a wrappable token?
data.body:
Is there a way to add `<` as a wrappable token?  What I mean by this is if you select `text` and hit `(` you get `(text)`.  If you do the same with `<` it wipes out the text.

If not, can I suggest it?  :)

data.title: Dg reopen project
TokenizedLine.tokenStartColumnForBufferColumn always returns NaN
data.body:
I believe `Token.bufferDelta` was removed in PR #11414, not too sure about that.

Anyway, there's still a lingering reference to `bufferDelta` in
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/tokenized-line.coffee#L42

``` coffee
  tokenStartColumnForBufferColumn: (bufferColumn) ->
    delta = 0
    for token in @tokens
      nextDelta = delta + token.bufferDelta
      break if nextDelta > bufferColumn
      delta = nextDelta
    delta
```

I believe that should read -- again, not too sure, not very familiar with Atom's guts:

``` coffee
  tokenStartColumnForBufferColumn: (bufferColumn) ->
    delta = 0
    for token in @tokens
      nextDelta = delta + token.value.length
      break if nextDelta > bufferColumn
      delta = nextDelta
    delta
```

/cc @nathansobo -- I think you originally wrote `tokenStartColumnForBufferColumn`

data.title: subword selection behaves differently for UPPER_CASE and lower_case
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I stumbled upon this subword selection feature (really nice :smile:). However I do have some painpoints related to how the selection stops.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Write this on an empty editor.

```
this is   an example
this_is_an_example
THIS_IS_AN_EXAMPLE
THIS_is_anExample
this_is   an_example
thisIsAnExample
this__is___an__example
```
1. Position your cursor on the beginning of the file and execute `editor:select-to-end-of-word` 4 times, take note of the behavior.
2. Position your cursor back to the beginning of the file.
3. Execute `editor:select-to-next-subword-boundary` 4 times.
4. If there are more lines, go to the beginning of the next line and go to step 4 until all lines are processed.

**Expected behavior:**
Every line had the same behavior on step 4 compared to what happened on step 2.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
On step 4...
- :x:  Line 1 stopped at spaces which is ok, but the next execution should select the spaces plus the next word.
- :white_check_mark: Line 2 behaved just as expected. 
- :x: Line 3 behaved like line 1 but with underscores instead of spaces.
- :x: Line 4 just like line 1 did the same on the first underscore, but not on the second one.
     It did stop at the "camel case".
- :x: Line 5 worked as expected selecting the underscores worked, but not the space.
- :white_check_mark: Line 6 as expected.
- :white_check_mark: Line 7 same.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1
Linux 4.4.0-38-generic #57~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP x86_64 GNU/Linux
